explanation.text:
Explanation
The Lord did not want the Israelites to worship foreign gods and being married to these foreigners could turn their hearts from God. 1 kings 11

text: God commanded Solomon not to marry from among the Moabites, Amorites, Edomites, Sidonians and the Hitties because they___________

options.text: Were not submissive to their Husbands
Would not worship the God of Israel
Would still go after other Men
Would turn away his heart after their gods

subject: CHRISTIAN RELIGIOUS KNOWLEDGE CRK

explanation.text:
Explanation
It means that when you give to the needy, do it secretly. If you give to bring attention to yourself, you don't get a reward in heaven because you already have your reward in all the attention you got. So do all good works in secret as much as possible, not just giving. God will see your good works and will reward you. Matthew 6:3

text: ....But when you give alms, do not let your left hand know what your right hand is doing....

options.text: One give only what one has
One does not give from freewill
One gives only what is requested

subject: CHRISTIAN RELIGIOUS KNOWLEDGE CRK

explanation.text:
Explanation
He rewards the meek with inheritance of the earth

text: In order to receive a reward of inheritance, Paul exhorts believers to________

options.text: Always pray for their daily bread

subject: CHRISTIAN RELIGIOUS KNOWLEDGE CRK

explanation.text:
Explanation
And the Lord said to Samuel, “How long will you grieve for Saul, since I have rejected him as king over Israel? 1samuel 16:1

text: .......How long will you grieve over Saul.... On what occasion did God make the statement above to Samuel?
subject: CHRISTIAN RELIGIOUS KNOWLEDGE CRK

explanation.text:
Explanation
Genesis 1:21 So God created the great creatures of the sea and every living thing with which the water teems and that moves about in it, according to their kinds, and every winged bird according to its kind. And God saw that it was good. This was done on Day5

text: On which day did God create sea creatures and all living things?
subject: CHRISTIAN RELIGIOUS KNOWLEDGE CRK

explanation.text:
Explanation
Paul's teaching on Humility (Philippians 2:1-11) In his letter to the Philippians, Paul appealed to his audience to be of one mind (united) in all that they do, and to love each other and value others above oneself.

text: In Paul's letter to the Philippians, he encouraged believers to demonstrate humility by__________

options.text: Giving honour and respect to Church elders
Honoring their Fathers and Mothers in the Lord
Not seeking their own interest but that of others

subject: CHRISTIAN RELIGIOUS KNOWLEDGE CRK

explanation.text:
Explanation
Ezekiel 37:1-10 
The Bible says these bones were "very dry" (verse 2). There wasn't any hope of life. Giving life to the dry bones represents restoration and hope

text: The vision of the dry bones of Ezekiel portrays___________
subject: CHRISTIAN RELIGIOUS KNOWLEDGE CRK

explanation.text:
Explanation
No one claimed that any of their possessions was their own, but they shared. They lived a communal life. Acts4:32

text: No one lacked in the Early Church because__________

options.text: The grace of God was upon them
They shared all they had in common

subject: CHRISTIAN RELIGIOUS KNOWLEDGE CRK

explanation.text:
Explanation
Nehemiah 1:2 Hanani, one of my brothers, came from Judah with some other men, and I questioned them about the Jewish remnant that had survived the exile, and also about Jerusalem.

text: Nehemiah inquired about the state of Jerusalem from_________
subject: CHRISTIAN RELIGIOUS KNOWLEDGE CRK

explanation.text:
Explanation
Elijah proposes a direct test of the powers of Baal and the Jewish God. The people of Israel, 450 prophets of Baal, and 400 prophets of Asherah are summoned to Mount Carmel. Fire fell and consumed the sacrifice, wood, stones, soil and water, which prompted the Israelite witnesses to proclaim, "The LORD, He is God! The LORD, He is God!"

text: In the contest on Mount Carmel, the true God answered with__________
subject: CHRISTIAN RELIGIOUS KNOWLEDGE CRK

explanation.text:
Explanation
Jeremiah 1 :5 “Before I formed you in the womb I knew you, before you were born I set you apart; I appointed you as a prophet to the nations.”
6 “Alas, Sovereign Lord,” I said, “I do not know how to speak; I am too young.”

text: Jeremiah was not ready to accept God's call as a prophet because______

options.text: The people would not listen to him
He was too young and inexperienced
He needed to know God more

subject: CHRISTIAN RELIGIOUS KNOWLEDGE CRK

explanation.text:
Explanation
Mark16:3 When the Sabbath was over, Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James, and Salome bought spices so they could go and anoint Jesus’ body.

text: According to Mark, The number of Women that went to Jesus Tomb on the Morning of his resurrection to anoint him were___________
subject: CHRISTIAN RELIGIOUS KNOWLEDGE CRK

explanation.text:
Explanation
Jonah2:1-7 From inside the fish Jonah prayed to the Lord his God.

text: When my soul fainted within me, I remembered the LORD..... Where was Jonah when he made this statement?

options.text: In the boat of the Mariners
In the belly of the fish

subject: CHRISTIAN RELIGIOUS KNOWLEDGE CRK

explanation.text:
Explanation
No official explanation is available for this question at this time. Please check contributions posted by others below. If you can provide an explanation to help other student learn, please click here

text: In his first letter to Timothy, Paul warned believers aganist the love of money, because it contends with their__________
subject: CHRISTIAN RELIGIOUS KNOWLEDGE CRK

explanation.text:
Explanation
Matthew13: 27 The owner’s servants came to him and said, ‘Sir, didn’t you sow good seed in your field? Where then did the weeds come from?’ 
28‘An enemy did this,’ he replied. So the servants asked him, ‘Do you want us to go and pull them up?’…

text: ........Sir, did you not sow good seed in your field? How then has it weeds What  was the response of the master to the statement above?
subject: CHRISTIAN RELIGIOUS KNOWLEDGE CRK

explanation.text:
Explanation
It was occasioned by the insistence of certain Judaic Christians from Jerusalem that Gentile Christians from Antioch in Syria obey the Mosaic custom of circumcision. A delegation, led by the Apostle Paul and his companion St. Barnabas, was appointed to confer with the elders of the church in Jerusalem

text: The council that was held to decide on the issue of circumcision was at________
subject: CHRISTIAN RELIGIOUS KNOWLEDGE CRK

explanation.text:
Explanation
Your love is like a morning cloud, like the dew that goes early away. Hosea 6:4

text: Hosea compared Judah's love for he Lord to the morning clouds because it_________

options.text: Went away early like the dew

subject: CHRISTIAN RELIGIOUS KNOWLEDGE CRK

explanation.text:
Explanation
Then the people who had arrested Jesus led him to the home of Caiaphas, the high priest, where the teachers of religious law and the elders had gathered. Matthew 26:57

text: According to Mathew, when Jesus was arrested, He led to_____________
subject: CHRISTIAN RELIGIOUS KNOWLEDGE CRK

explanation.text:
Explanation
The Parable of the Sower  is a parable of Jesus found in the three Synoptic Gospels in Matthew 13:1-23, Mark 4:1-20, and Luke 8:4-15. ''Some seed falls on the path (wayside) with no soil, some on rocky ground with little soil, and some on soil which contained thorns''.

text: The way in which various people hear the word of God is described in the parable of the ______
subject: CHRISTIAN RELIGIOUS KNOWLEDGE CRK

explanation.text:
Explanation
An Elder who exhibits the tenets of Peter's charge will not behave as if you are more important than someone and have a right to tell that person what to do. They will exhibit humility

text: .....Tend the flock of God...not as domineering over those in your charge but being examples to the flock... An Elder who exhibits the tenets of Peter's charge in the statement above would be displaying_______
subject: CHRISTIAN RELIGIOUS KNOWLEDGE CRK

explanation.text:
Explanation
Romans 6:4,: "We were buried therefore with him by baptism into death, in order that, just as Christ was raised from the dead by the glory of the Father, we too might walk in newness of life."

text: According to Romans, believers are raised from the dead by the Father so that they walk in________
subject: CHRISTIAN RELIGIOUS KNOWLEDGE CRK

explanation.text:
Explanation
 Fathers, do not provoke your children to anger, but bring them up in the discipline Ephesians 6:4

text: According to Ephesians, Paul enjoins Fathers not to__________
subject: CHRISTIAN RELIGIOUS KNOWLEDGE CRK

explanation.text:
Explanation
Jesus entered Jerusalem and went into the temple courts. He looked around at everything, but since it was already late, he went out to Bethany with the Twelve. Mark 11:11

text: According to Mark, after Jesus had triumphantly entered Jerusalem, He__________

options.text: Went to Bethany with the twelve

subject: CHRISTIAN RELIGIOUS KNOWLEDGE CRK

explanation.text:
Explanation
Everyone who does evil hates the light, and will not come into the light for fear that their deeds will be exposed. John 3:20-21

text: According to the gospel of John, everyone who does evil hates___________
subject: CHRISTIAN RELIGIOUS KNOWLEDGE CRK

explanation.text:
Explanation
In the 20th year of Artaxerxes I (445 or 444 BC), Nehemiah was cup-bearer to the king. Learning that the remnant of Jews in Judah were in distress and that the walls of Jerusalem were broken down, he asked the king for permission to return and rebuild the city. Nehemiah 1:1-7

text: Nehemiah decided to go back to Jerusalem because of_____________

options.text: The bad state in which Jerusalem was
His very long stay in Susa
The altar God told him build for him
The cruel treatment given to him by his Master

subject: CHRISTIAN RELIGIOUS KNOWLEDGE CRK

explanation.text:
Explanation
 if any of you lacks wisdom, let him ask of God, who gives to all generously and without reproach, and it will be given to him. James 1:5

text: James enjoins believers who lack wisdom to____________
subject: CHRISTIAN RELIGIOUS KNOWLEDGE CRK

explanation.text:
Explanation
Joshua gathered all the tribes of Israel to Shechem, and called for the elders . Joshua 24:1-13

text: Joshua gathered all the tribes of Israel and elders before God to renew the Covenant at__________
subject: CHRISTIAN RELIGIOUS KNOWLEDGE CRK

explanation.text:
Explanation
One reason God prohibited the consumption of animal blood in the Old Testament was to teach respect for the sacredness of life. Genesis 9

text: God commanded Noah not to eat the blood of animals because___________

options.text: It could lead man into covenant with Satan
The blood of animals is meant for idols

subject: CHRISTIAN RELIGIOUS KNOWLEDGE CRK

explanation.text:
Explanation
In Numbers 27, upon arrival at Mount Abarim, God tells Moses to go up the mountain see the land and then die. However, God does not tell Moses who his successor will be. Moses reacts in panic and requests a successor be appointed before he dies. God then informs Moses that his successor will be Joshua, and that he should stand him before Elazar the priest and the people and appoint him, which Moses does.

text: Moses commissioned Joshua as the new leader of Israel in the presence of_________
subject: CHRISTIAN RELIGIOUS KNOWLEDGE CRK

explanation.text:
Explanation
And Daniel was over them, for there was an excellent spirit in him; Daniel 6:3

text: Daniel became distinguished above all the other presidents and satraps because_______

options.text: The spirit of wisdom was in him
An excellent spirit was in him

subject: CHRISTIAN RELIGIOUS KNOWLEDGE CRK

explanation.text:
Explanation
The LORD sent Nathan to David.  2 samuel12

text: The prophet who rebuked King David for his Adultery with Uriah's wife was_______
subject: CHRISTIAN RELIGIOUS KNOWLEDGE CRK

explanation.text:
Explanation
Christians living at the time of this event will not die, but will be changed and shall be caught up together in the clouds to meet the Lord in the air.

text: According to Paul's teaching concerning the second coming of Jesus, the believers will meet the Lord when he is_________
subject: CHRISTIAN RELIGIOUS KNOWLEDGE CRK

explanation.text:
Explanation
Awe; a feeling of reverential respect mixed with fear or wonder.

text: If asked to examine Jesus action of cleansing the Temple, what emotions do you think he evoked?
subject: CHRISTIAN RELIGIOUS KNOWLEDGE CRK

explanation.text:
Explanation
Blessed are they who hunger and thirst for righteousness, for they shall be satisfied.  Matthew 5:3-10

text: According to the beatitudes, the blessing for those who hunger and thirst for righteousness is________
subject: CHRISTIAN RELIGIOUS KNOWLEDGE CRK

explanation.text:
Explanation
And Jesus said to him, See you tell no man; but go your way, show yourself to the priest, and offer the gift that Moses commanded, for a testimony to them. Matthew 8:4
In sending the lepers to the priests Jesus is giving them their opportunity to reconnect with loved ones, re-establish careers and resume normal worship and avoid confrontation. It has to do with reintegrating them into society. Priests were able to verify that someone was healthy and had been cured

text: .......But go, show yourself to the priest and offer the gift that moses commanded.... Jesus made the statement above because___________

options.text: He did not want confrontation from the pharisees
There was need to show appreciation
Such offerings serve as a proof to the people
Without such offerings, the leprosy might come back

subject: CHRISTIAN RELIGIOUS KNOWLEDGE CRK

explanation.text:
Explanation
As Jesus was walking beside the Sea of Galilee, he saw two brothers, Simon called Peter and his brother Andrew. Matthew 4:18

text: As Jesus walked by the sea of Galilee, he called_________
subject: CHRISTIAN RELIGIOUS KNOWLEDGE CRK

explanation.text:
Explanation
And Jehoshaphat maketh peace with the king of Israel; 1kings 22:44

text: Who among these Kings of Judah made peace with the King of Israel during his reign________
subject: CHRISTIAN RELIGIOUS KNOWLEDGE CRK

Explanation

explanation.text:
Explanation
1kings 21:-16
Now there was a man named Naboth, from Jezreel, who owned a vineyard in Jezreel beside the palace of King Ahab of Samaria. One day Ahab said to Naboth, “Since your vineyard is so convenient to my palace, I would like to buy it to use as a vegetable garden. I will give you a better vineyard in exchange, or if you prefer, I will pay you for it.”

text: The Main reason King Ahab demanded for Naboth's Vineyard was because he_________

options.text: Wanted to add it to his multiple vineyards
Said that the Vineyard was near his House
Intended to use it for a fruit garden
Knew that Naboth was not an Israelite

subject: CHRISTIAN RELIGIOUS KNOWLEDGE CRK

explanation.text:
Explanation
Romans 3:23 Because all people have sinned, they have fallen short of God's glory.
24' and are justified freely by His grace through the redemption that is in Christ Jesus.

text: According to Paul in Romans, since all have sinned and fallen short of the glory of God, they are justified by__________

And Jesus said to him, See you tell no man; but go your way, show yourself to the priest, and offer the gift that Moses commanded, for a testimony to them. Matthew 8:4
In sending the lepers to the priests Jesus is giving them their opportunity to reconnect with loved ones, re-establish careers and resume normal worship and avoid confrontation. It has to do with reintegrating them into society. Priests were able to verify that someone was healthy and had been cured

text: .......But go, show yourself to the priest and offer the gift that moses commanded.... Jesus made the statement above because___________

options.text: He did not want confrontation from the pharisees
There was need to show appreciation
Such offerings serve as a proof to the people
Without such offerings, the leprosy might come back

1kings 21:-16
Now there was a man named Naboth, from Jezreel, who owned a vineyard in Jezreel beside the palace of King Ahab of Samaria. One day Ahab said to Naboth, “Since your vineyard is so convenient to my palace, I would like to buy it to use as a vegetable garden. I will give you a better vineyard in exchange, or if you prefer, I will pay you for it.”

text: The Main reason King Ahab demanded for Naboth's Vineyard was because he_________

options.text: Wanted to add it to his multiple vineyards
Said that the Vineyard was near his House
Intended to use it for a fruit garden
Knew that Naboth was not an Israelite

explanation.text:
Explanation
Spiritual gifts are ‘spiritual’ in nature for they are given by the Holy Spirit to every believer (1 Corinthians 12:7-11).
Each gift is a manifestation of the Spirit (1 Corinthians 12:7).
Spiritual gifts are ‘spiritual’ in that they are given only to those who are believers in Jesus Christ. Also, spiritual gifts differ from human talents and abilities in that they result in ‘spiritual’ fruit.

text: In his teaching on spiritual gifts in Corinthians, Paul said that all gifts are inspired by
subject: CHRISTIAN RELIGIOUS KNOWLEDGE CRK

explanation.text:
Explanation
But when he says one must be subject. lest anyone submit to the authorities half heartedly and not from pure love, Paul adds: not only to avoid…wrath, but also for the sake of conscience. that is to say, you should not submit simply to avoid the authority’s anger, which can be done by pretense, but so that you might be assured in your conscience that you are doing this out of love for him . see Romans 13:5..

text: Paul in Romans advised believers to respect those in authority to avoid God's wrath and also for the sake of
subject: CHRISTIAN RELIGIOUS KNOWLEDGE CRK

text:
''An eye for an eye and a tooth for a tooth...''

options.text: give and take is an ideal way of life
retaliation should be in equal measure to the offence

explanation.text:
Explanation
It means that when you give to the needy, do it secretly. If you give to bring attention to yourself, you don't get a reward in heaven because you already have your reward in all the attention you got. So do all good works in secret as much as possible, not just giving. God will see your good works and will reward you. Matthew 6:3

text: ....But when you give alms, do not let your left hand know what your right hand is doing....

options.text: One give only what one has
One does not give from freewill
One gives only what is requested

Elijah proposes a direct test of the powers of Baal and the Jewish God. The people of Israel, 450 prophets of Baal, and 400 prophets of Asherah are summoned to Mount Carmel. Fire fell and consumed the sacrifice, wood, stones, soil and water, which prompted the Israelite witnesses to proclaim, "The LORD, He is God! The LORD, He is God!"

In Numbers 27, upon arrival at Mount Abarim, God tells Moses to go up the mountain see the land and then die. However, God does not tell Moses who his successor will be. Moses reacts in panic and requests a successor be appointed before he dies. God then informs Moses that his successor will be Joshua, and that he should stand him before Elazar the priest and the people and appoint him, which Moses does.

explanation.text:
Explanation
And Jesus said to him, See you tell no man; but go your way, show yourself to the priest, and offer the gift that Moses commanded, for a testimony to them. Matthew 8:4
In sending the lepers to the priests Jesus is giving them their opportunity to reconnect with loved ones, re-establish careers and resume normal worship and avoid confrontation. It has to do with reintegrating them into society. Priests were able to verify that someone was healthy and had been cured

text: .......But go, show yourself to the priest and offer the gift that moses commanded.... Jesus made the statement above because___________

options.text: He did not want confrontation from the pharisees
There was need to show appreciation
Such offerings serve as a proof to the people
Without such offerings, the leprosy might come back

Explanation
1kings 21:-16
Now there was a man named Naboth, from Jezreel, who owned a vineyard in Jezreel beside the palace of King Ahab of Samaria. One day Ahab said to Naboth, “Since your vineyard is so convenient to my palace, I would like to buy it to use as a vegetable garden. I will give you a better vineyard in exchange, or if you prefer, I will pay you for it.”

text: The Main reason King Ahab demanded for Naboth's Vineyard was because he_________

options.text: Wanted to add it to his multiple vineyards
Said that the Vineyard was near his House
Intended to use it for a fruit garden
Knew that Naboth was not an Israelite
